subject: RE: [junit] Private method throws an exception
msgSnippet: Thanks for the feedback. My private method fails (during test execution) because it interacts with Torque (OR mapping tool) to talk to the database.  Because
messageBody:
Thanks for the feedback.



My private method fails (during test execution) because it interacts with Torque (OR mapping tool) to talk to the database. Because this method is private, I can’t override it in a base class, and I’m a bit at a loss for how to avoid its Torque interaction. I’m feeling that there must be an injection technique that I can use to get a mock object into that method to circumvent the Torque interaction.



Any suggestions?



-Mitch



FWIW, I agree with Elliotte about making the private method public/protected.



_____

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Elliotte Harold
Sent: Sunday, October 30, 2005 10:45 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Private method throws an exception



mitchellch60 wrote:
> My method under test calls a private method in the same class. The
> private method throws an exception preventing me for completing my
> unit test.
>

The test is failing. That means your code is broken (or just maybe the
test is broken instead). Either way, fix the breakage, wherever it lies.
Some of the other suggestions you've gotten here are actively harmful
and won't solve your problem (Making the private method public? Bleah.)


--
﻿Elliotte Rusty Harold elharo@...
